technique_name: Closed Guard Pass to Side Control (Roll Prevention)
portuguese_name: Passagem de Guarda para Controle Lateral (Impedindo a Rolagem)
description: This technique teaches how to pass the closed guard and establish side control while specifically preventing the opponent from rolling or inverting. It emphasizes securing key grips and body positioning to flatten the opponent and maintain dominance.

sequential_diagram_steps.label: Freeing the Knee
sequential_diagram_steps.detail: The top player pushes their trapped leg through the opponent's armpit to free their knee from the leg entanglement.

sequential_diagram_steps.label: Blocking Opponent's Roll
sequential_diagram_steps.detail: Immediately after freeing the knee, the top player secures grips on the opponent's belt and pants, effectively blocking any attempt to roll or sweep.

sequential_diagram_steps.label: Deep Lapel Grip & Posture
sequential_diagram_steps.detail: The top player transitions to a deep lapel grip around the opponent's far shoulder while maintaining the belt grip to pull themselves up and establish strong leverage.

sequential_diagram_steps.label: Flatten to Side Control
sequential_diagram_steps.detail: By stretching one leg and executing hip escapes, the top player flattens the opponent's entire back to the mat and establishes a dominant side control position.
